title.narrative: Design Of Coahuila´S Integral Strategy Of Adequate Housing And Sustainable Urbanization, Aligned To The Principles Of The New Urban Agenda And The Sustainable Development Goals

description.narrative:
Technical assistance will be carried out to support the effort of the newly created Ministry of Housing and Land Management and the Ministry of Infrastructure, Urban Development, Mobility in the state of Coahuila, with the purpose to define a strategy that on the one hand contributes to the urban integration of inadequate housing already existing; as well as to lay the foundations for the construction of new complex rooms that adhere to the principles of adequate housing.
The realization of the Project is relevant and justified because the situation in Coahuila reflects the chaos in the development of housing that has arisen nationwide. This means that Housing, predominantly social, has been built in the unconsolidated areas of urban settlements that are generally located on the periphery; therefore, they are difficult to access, are disconnected from urban centres and offer limited access to development opportunities.
Likewise, preference has been given to the design of horizontal cities characterized by low density, high dependence on private vehicles as a means of transport and high levels of pollution. As well as the degradation of urban infrastructure and the lack of public spaces and green areas. All together for the government represents a great challenge due to the higher demand of the provision of public services that are increasingly expensive due to the remoteness in which the new housing complexes are located.
The result of this situation is to have a high number of abandoned or disused homes because they do not offer the necessary conditions to live in them and their inhabitants decide to lose their assets to move to other units that, if they have the necessary services and , usually, closer to your workplace.
The technical assistance offered to the Government of Coahuila is aligned with the Sustainable Development Goal 11: Sustainable cities and communities, specifically with goals 11.1, 11.2 and 11.3 that address ensuring access for all people to adequate housing and services, access to mobility and to increase inclusive and sustainable urbanization.
Likewise, it is aligned to the National Development Program 2019-2024 which, under Axis 2: Social Policy, contemplates in section VIII Urban Development and Housing that “social housing will be a priority and thousands of improvement, extension and development actions will be carried out.” [1]
The federation, through the Ministry of Agrarian, Territorial and Urban Development (SEDATU for its acronym in Spanish), is responsible for "developing and conducting housing policies"[2] and "issuing the guidelines on (...) land use or use, as well as housing"[3] justifying the involvement of said agency, as well as the national agencies related to the housing that depend on it.
The Agricultural, Territorial and Urban Development Sector Program 2019-2024 is currently under development and UN-Habitat has been part of the elaboration process in which the general housing policies will be defined. In that sense, SEDATU has assumed the rectory of the housing policy and the maximum objective is that every family can enjoy adequate housing, which is in full agreement with the purpose of the work that will be carried out in Coahuila.
The attributions of the federative entities (also known as states) are “to promote the fulfillment and effective protection of human rights related to the territorial planning of human settlements, urban development and housing”[4], which is why legally the counterpart - the Government of Coahuila - would have powers on the object of technical assistance to be carried out.
Accordingly, it is aligned with the State Development Program 2017-2023 of the State of Coahuila that in its Axis 4: Social, inclusive and participatory development with its Objective 4.9: Housing and basic services whose central premise is “to contribute so that coahuilenses in a situation of vulnerability and with lower economic income have access to decent housing, improving the quality of materials, with basic services and providing their inhabitants with legal certainty about their heritage.” [5]
By virtue of the foregoing, it can be affirmed that the proposal for technical assistance is in full agreement with the principles and objectives of the global agendas, as well as the guidelines of the national and state government.
The Project has been conceptualized from an integrated perspective in which it has sought to create a balance between its normative, planning, and operational components. The purpose is to anchor institutional changes in legislation and regulations to ensure its adoption; besides considering the inclusion of the design of an institutional mechanism for the observation of its application in the long term; and finally, the strengthening of the installed technical capacities of local governments considering their transcendental role in the territorial application of the strategy.
It is through the integration of these components that it is ensured that there is a joint support between the normative and the operation aspects, ensuring that this raises the chances of success to achieve the objectives and the expected benefits that have been raised. In addition to contributing to improve the installed capacity of local actors contributing to the appropriation of the project so that it can be implemented without the need for permanent assistance from the agency.
[1] National Development Program consulted in https://www.dof.gob.mx/nota_detalle.php?codigo=5565599 fecha=12/07/2019
[2] Article 41 Section I of the Organic Law of the Public Administration of Mexico.
[3] Article 8 Section IV of the General Law of Human Settlements of Mexico.
[4] Article 10 Section III of the General Law of Human Settlements of Mexico.
[5] State Development Program consulted in https://coahuila.gob.mx/archivos/pdf/Publicaciones/PED2017-2023/Plan_Estatal_Desarrollo_baja.pdf
